147: SPECIFIC NOTES FOR CURTAIN WALL TYPES
148: THE CURTAIN WALL CONTRACTOR MUST WORK WITH THE STRUCTURE OF
149: CONCRETE AND STEEL FRAMES PROVIDED IN STRUCTURE AND
150: ARCHITECTURE DOCUMENTS FOR SEATING AND FIXING OF THEIR WORK. SHOULD IT BE FOUND
151: THAT THESE FRAMES ARE INSUFFICIENT, THE SUPPLY AND INSTALLATION OF FRAMES
152: ADDITIONAL REQUIRED FOR PROPER COMPLETION OF THEIR WORK
153: WOULD BE ENTIRELY AT THE EXPENSE OF THE CURTAIN WALL CONTRACTOR. LIKEWISE, ALL
154: PARTS FOR SEATING AND FIXING OF CURTAIN WALLS
155: MUST BE DESIGNED AND INSTALLED SO THAT THEY ARE IN NO
156: WAY VISIBLE FROM INSIDE OR IN CONFLICT WITH PLANNED
157: INTERIOR ARRANGEMENTS. ALL SUCH ITEMS MUST BE APPROVED AND PLANS
158: SIGNED BY THE CURTAIN WALL MANUFACTURER'S ENGINEER.
